department: Department of Parks, Culture and Recreation
short_summary: Parks Canada procures exhibits, projects and communications services for various locations
description: Exhibits, national parks, national marine conservation areas and urban national parks managed by Parks Canada
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement: RFSA - Exhibits and Project Development Services

## Solicitation Number
*numsolicitationtampon*.5P300-23-0156/A

## Solicitation Title
RFSA - Exhibits: Project Management, Content Development, Design, Writing, Fabrication, and Installation Services

## Publication Date
2024-05-15

## Tender Closing Date
2100-12-31T14:00:00

## Expected Contract Start Date
2024-05-15

## Expected Contract End Date
2100-12-31

## Tender Description
Parks Canada is currently seeking bids for a turnkey or à la carte project management, content development, and design services for various exhibits within the network of National Historic Sites, National Parks, Urban National Parks, and National Marine Conservation Areas managed by Parks Canada. The RFSA covers two procurement streams: General and Indigenous Business. Suppliers must be able to provide goods and services across Canada or in multiple regions.

## Contract Details
- Maximum expenditure: $3,749,999.99
- Duration: Specific period, or until Canada no longer finds it advantageous
- Locations: Exemptions apply under Comprehensive Land Claim Agreements and National Capital Region

## Notice Additional Information
The RFSA is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). Suppliers must certify they qualify as Indigenous businesses to be considered.

## Suppliers Conference
A suppliers conference will be held virtually on June 5, 2024, in English (13:00 HAE) and French (11:00 HAE). Register with Helene Periard, at helene.periard@pc.gc.ca, to confirm attendance.

## Enquiries
All inquiries must be submitted in writing, referencing the relevant DAMA item number, to Helene Periard. Technical inquiries marked proprietary will be treated as such.

## Notice Public Buying Program

Canada's open and accessible bidding process aims to provide opportunities to suppliers contracted through our Government's procurement tool, Compensation and Benefits (Combur). Notice public buying is available to the public interest, and contracts are awarded on a competitive basis. Please refer to the Canadian Government's public buying website for more information.

Access RFSA documents, including the solicitation document, through Canada Buys. Addenda, if issued, will also be available on the website.

# Attachments

Please see the attachments uploaded to Canada Buys for the specification documents.

Now that you have followed the specified structure, here are the updates
